‘Henry Fitzmaurice Hallam‚ the younger son of Henry Hallam‚ Esq.‚ was born on the 31st of August 1824 ; he took his second name from his godfather‚ the Marquis of Lansdowne ..... Α habit of re· serve‚ which characterized him at all periods of life, but which was compensated in the eyes of even his first companions by a singular sweetness of temper, was produced and fostered by the serious thoughtfulness ensuing upon early familiarity with domestic sorrow.

closest school-friends, “retiring, thoughtful to pen- sivenesS, affectionate‚ without envy or jealousy, almost without emulation, impressible, but not want- ing in moral firmness. Religion had a real effect upon his char- acter, and made him tranquil about great things, though he was so nervous about little things.”
